name: Low-Dose Lithium (Pharmaceutical)
description: Lithium at sub-therapeutic doses (150-300mcg to 5mg) for neuroprotection and longevity, far below psychiatric doses (600-1200mg). Population studies show lower all-cause mortality and dementia rates in regions with higher lithium in drinking water.

dosage.notes: Sub-therapeutic dose — NOT psychiatric dosing. Lithium orotate preferred (better CNS penetration at low doses). No blood level monitoring needed at these doses.

keyFindings: Higher lithium in drinking water associated with lower suicide, dementia, and all-cause mortality
Extended lifespan in C. elegans and Drosophila models
Low-dose lithium reduced biomarkers of Alzheimer disease progression
